Shortcuts Shortcut Options Unfortunately, Android TV limits the functionality of accessibility services and third-party launchers. Return to Settings
Android TV Launcher Manager You may be able to install a third-party application to change the default home on Android TV. \n \nThis requires ADB Debugging to be enabled, and may not work on every device. \n \nLook up "Android TV Launcher Manager XDA", then manually download & install.
Or… Just Use the Back Button! If you just use the back button on your remote, instead of the home button, you will always come back to Lightning Launcher. \n \nPressing back once you get to the launcher will just toggle edit mode, keeping you from accidentally returning to the default launcher.
Redirects open Lighting Launcher when hovering a dock icon. \nEach redirect must be individually installed, then activated.
You may be able to add this app\'s icon directly to the dock How to Add Lightning Launcher to the Quest Dock Adding LL to the Dock
Remove an existing icon 1. Close all other 2D and VR apps. \n2. Pick an icon to remove. (Camera or Browser) \n3. Click and hold the icon. \n4. Drag it down until it says \'Unpin\', then release. Feed, Store, and People can\'t be removed.
Add Lightning Launcher\'s Icon 1. Find Lightning Launcher in recent apps. \n\t\t(Right side of the dock) \n2. Drag Lightning Launcher to the left side. \n3. Release to pin it to the dock.
You can\'t have more than five apps pinned.
Add Dock Icon Redirect Built-In Dock Icons
Feed Redirect Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you press the Horizon Feed button on the dock. Library Redirect Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you hover the App Library button on the dock. Store Redirect Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you hover the Store button on the dock. People Redirect Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you hover the People button on the dock.
Shortcuts for Dock UI The Dock is a bar with the time and a row of app icons - which is always present below 2D windows. The dock has been part of the Quest UI since the beginning, but it is being replaced by the Navigator. I have the Dock
Shortcuts for Navigator UI The Navigator is a special overlay which opens in front of your 2D windows and lets you launch official apps. Meta is rolling this new UI out to some Quest devices. If you have the Navigator, you won\'t have a Dock. I have the Navigator
Open Lightning Launcher with Navigator Button You must install the service application, then activate it.
Navigator Button Redirection Service Install, then activate, to open Lightning Launcher when you press the Meta / Navigator button. You\'ll still be able to open the Navigator by pressing the button again - after Lightning Launcher is open.
